***** Hindi[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
Inherited from Sauraseni_Prakrit 𑀫𑀸𑀤𑀸 (mādā), from Sanskrit मातृ (mātṛ,
“mother”), from Proto-Indo-Iranian *máHtā, from Proto-Indo-European *méh₂tēr.
Doublet of माता (mātā), a tatsama. Compare Punjabi ਮਾਂ (mā̃), Gujarati મા (mā),
માં (mā̃), Bengali মা (ma), Assamese মা (ma), Oriya ମା (ma), Marathi माय (māy),
Konkani मांय (mā̃y).
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (Delhi Hindi) IPA(key): /mɑ̃ː/, [mä̃ː]
**** Noun[edit] ****
माँ • (mā̃) f (Urdu spelling ماں‎)
   1. (informal) mother
            Synonyms: माता (mātā), जननी (jannī), अंबा (ambā), (Muslim usage)
            वालिदा (vālidā)
   2. (endearing) mum, mummy
            Synonyms: अम्मी (ammī), अम्मा (ammā), माऊ (māū), मैया (maiyā)
*** Declension[edit] ***
Declension of माँ (fem ā̃-stem)
                                    singular plural
                           direct   माँ      माएँ
                                    mā̃      māẽ
                           oblique  माँ      माओं
                                    mā̃      māõ
                           vocative माँ      माओं
                                    mā̃      māõ
*** Derived terms[edit] ***
    * माँ-बाप (mā̃-bāp)
